RAIDS 0.50.0

    • Accurate Inference of Genetic Ancestry from Cancer Sequencing

    Compute the list of pruned SNVs for a specific sample using the information from the 1KG GDS file and the

    pruningSample.Rd

    Compute the list of pruned SNVs for a specific sample. When a group of SNVs are in linkage disequilibrium, only one SNV from that group is retained. The linkage disequilibrium is calculated with the snpgdsLDpruning() function.

    pruningSample(
  gds,
  method = c("corr", "r", "dprime", "composite"),
  sampleCurrent,
  study.id,
  listSNP = NULL,
  slide.max.bp.v = 500000L,
  ld.threshold.v = sqrt(0.1),
  np = 1,
  verbose.v = FALSE,
  chr = NULL,
  minAF.SuperPop = NULL,
  keepGDSpruned = TRUE,
  PATHSAMPLEGDS = NULL,
  keepFile = FALSE,
  PATHPRUNED = ".",
  outPref = "pruned"
)

    Arguments

    gds

    an object of class gdsn.class, a GDS node pointing to the 1KG GDS file.

    method

    a character string that represents the method that will be used to calculate the linkage disequilibrium in the snpgdsLDpruning() function. The 4 possible values are: "corr", "r", "dprime" and "composite". Default: "corr".

    sampleCurrent

    a character string corresponding to the sample identifier used in LD pruning done by the snpgdsLDpruning() function.

    study.id

    A string corresponding to the study use in LDpruning

    listSNP

    the list of snp.id keep. TODO. Default: NULL.

    slide.max.bp.v

    a single positive integer that represents the maximum basepairs (bp) in the sliding window. This parameter is used for the LD pruning done in the snpgdsLDpruning function. Default: 500000L.

    ld.threshold.v

    a single numeric value that represents the LD threshold used in the snpgdsLDpruning function. Default: sqrt(0.1).

    np

    a single positive integer specifying the number of threads to be used. Default: 1L.

    verbose.v

    a logicial indicating if information is shown during the process in the snpgdsLDpruning function. Default: FALSE.

    chr

    TODO. Default: NULL.

    minAF.SuperPop

    TODO. Default: NULL.

    keepGDSpruned

    a logicial TODO. Default: TRUE.

    PATHSAMPLEGDS

    TODO

    keepFile

    a logical indicating if RDS files containing the information about the pruned SNVs must be created. Default: FALSE.

    PATHPRUNED

    a character string TODO. Default: ".".

    outPref

    a character string that represents the prefix of the RDS files that will be generated. The RDS files are only generated when the parameter keepFile=TRUE. Default: "pruned".

    Value

    The function returns 0L when successful.

    Author

    Pascal Belleau, Astrid Deschênes and Alexander Krasnitz

    Examples

    
## Path to the demo pedigree file is located in this package
data.dir <- system.file("extdata", package="RAIDS")
